# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, " ")
    lines = String[]
    
    current_line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " "$word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        
        current_line *= " $word"
    end
    
    # Add the last line
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```
You can use this function as below:

```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cras a nunc sed turpis commodo dictum."
print(wrap_string(text))
```
This will break the input text at each new line if it exceeds `text_width` characters and add a newline character between every word. The default value of `text_width` is 10, so in this example, the lines should be around 10 characters long, but can vary depending on your input text.
